channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Two Israeli embassy aides killed. And, House passes Trump's 'big, beautiful bill'
item.description: Two staff members of Israel's embassy in Washington, D.C., were shot dead last night outside of a Jewish museum. And, House Republicans passed President Trump's bill.
item.content:encoded:
Two staff members of Israel's embassy in Washington, D.C., were shot dead last night outside of a Jewish museum. And, House Republicans passed President Trump's bill.

(Image credit: ALEX WROBLEWSKI/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Scientists want to track the world's biodiversity using DNA in the air
item.description: Scientists have found a way to sample DNA out of the air on a large scale — making it possible to one day track the health and well being of all kinds of species around the world.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have found a way to sample DNA out of the air on a large scale — making it possible to one day track the health and well being of all kinds of species around the world.

(Image credit: Luis Echeverría for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Educators fear their homeless students could become a target for Trump cuts
item.description: A federal program provides extra help to make sure students experiencing homelessness get an education. Amid massive cuts to the federal government, the program's future is uncertain.
item.content:encoded:
A federal program provides extra help to make sure students experiencing homelessness get an education. Amid massive cuts to the federal government, the program's future is uncertain.

(Image credit: Josephine Sittenfeld for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Lee V. Gaines

item.title: A Newark air traffic controller on how it felt when systems went dark
item.description: An air traffic controller who works the airspace around Newark, N.J. speaks out about what it was like to lose radar and communication systems during a shift, and how the situation got to be so bad.
item.content:encoded:
An air traffic controller who works the airspace around Newark, N.J. speaks out about what it was like to lose radar and communication systems during a shift, and how the situation got to be so bad.

(Image credit: Kena Betancur)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: How Trump made a 30% tariff feel like a relief
item.description: It's a pattern in President Trump's chaotic tariff policy: he first suggests a high number, only to later ratchet it down. Business schools call it the 'anchor effect.'
item.content:encoded:
It's a pattern in President Trump's chaotic tariff policy: he first suggests a high number, only to later ratchet it down. Business schools call it the 'anchor effect.'

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Raising ethics questions, top Trump meme coin investors to dine with president tonight
item.description: President Trump is hosting an exclusive dinner tonight for the largest investors in the $TRUMP meme coin, putting the murky world of cryptocurrencies on a collision course with White House ethics.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is hosting an exclusive dinner tonight for the largest investors in the $TRUMP meme coin, putting the murky world of cryptocurrencies on a collision course with White House ethics.

(Image credit: Giuseppe Cacace)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Witnessing George Floyd's killing
item.description: How did the murder of George Floyd affect onlookers and online witnesses? Rev. Frenchye Magee, Professor Zinzi Bailey, and attorney Antonio Romanucci reflect on the response.
item.content:encoded: How did the murder of George Floyd affect onlookers and online witnesses? Rev. Frenchye Magee, Professor Zinzi Bailey, and attorney Antonio Romanucci reflect on the response.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Kermit the Frog to deliver commencement address at the University of Maryland graduation
item.description: The beloved Muppet, created in 1955, will deliver the commencement address at the University of Maryland, the alma mater of his creator Jim Henson.
item.content:encoded:
The beloved Muppet, created in 1955, will deliver the commencement address at the University of Maryland, the alma mater of his creator Jim Henson.

(Image credit: Kaitlin Newman)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: New Orleans Archdiocese agrees to pay nearly $180M to victims of clergy sexual abuse
item.description: Lawyers for survivors said they won't support the agreement, which they say was negotiated behind closed doors.
item.content:encoded:
Lawyers for survivors said they won't support the agreement, which they say was negotiated behind closed doors.

(Image credit: Gerald Herbert)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 2 Israeli Embassy aides are killed in a shooting in Washington, D.C., officials say
item.description: As attendees departed an event held by a Jewish advocacy organization in D.C. on Wednesday night, a shooter opened fire, killing two. Later, he chanted "free Palestine," D.C. police officials said.
item.content:encoded:
As attendees departed an event held by a Jewish advocacy organization in D.C. on Wednesday night, a shooter opened fire, killing two. Later, he chanted "free Palestine," D.C. police officials said.

(Image credit: Alex Wroblewski)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan
